name: pseudonym
content:

a name someone uses instead of their real name, especially on a written work: She writes under a pseudonym. George Orwell was a pseudonym - his real name was Eric Blair. Related word
pseudonymous
a number or name with no meaning that is used instead of information relating to a particular person, for example, a name or email address, so that it is impossible to see who the information relates to: A pseudonym is an identifier that relates to a particular individual. Pseudonymization uses a form of encryption to translate identifiable personal data to unique artificial identifiers called pseudonyms. Related word
pseudonymize
More examplesFewer examplesHe has published three crime novels under a pseudonym.She goes by the pseudonym of Nana.Their names, contact information , and other personal data will be kept out of public records by filing lawsuits under pseudonyms, such as John or Jane Doe.There can be a single pseudonym for a collection of replaced fields or a pseudonym per replaced field.
